title.narrative: Emergency Shelter Assistance for households severely affected by tornado in Dinajpur district

description.narrative: The project will provide emergency shelter assistance to the households severely affected by a tornado, which hit the Parbatipur and Nawabganj upazilas (sub-districts) of Dinajpur district on 26 April 2022. A total of 7,025 people have been displaced and the affected communities are now suffering from a lack of shelter, food and WASH facilities. In addition, at least 310 hectares of crops, including boro paddy, jute, corn, banana, mango and litchi have been destroyed. Some affected households are now meeting their basic needs through strategies that impact their long-term resilience, such as advance selling of crops, mortgaging household assets, advanced selling of labour at very low prices, and selling products at reduced prices. Through this 3-month project, Caritas Bangladesh will provide cash support to 162 households for shelter repair/reconstruction. Worse-affected and most vulnerable households will be targeted, including female-headed households and families that include a person with disability (PWD).
